Sure, here is a 3-day travel itinerary for your family trip to Xiamen, Fujian Province in the summer:

Day 1:
9:00 am - 11:00 am: Gulangyu Island - Take a ferry to Gulangyu Island and explore its scenic beauty. The island is famous for its beaches, colonial architecture, and gardens. Visit the Shuzhuang Garden, which has beautiful lotus ponds, rock formations, and scenic views.
11:00 am - 12:00 pm: Lunch time
12:00 pm - 3:00 pm: Hulishan Fortress - Visit Hulishan Fortress, a historic fortress built in the late 19th century. The fortress features a unique blend of Western and Chinese architecture and is surrounded by beautiful gardens. Your kids might enjoy exploring the fortress and learning about its history.
3:00 pm - 5:00 pm: Xiamen Underwater World - Take your family to the Xiamen Underwater World, which features a diverse range of marine life, including sharks, dolphins, and sea turtles. The aquarium offers various interactive exhibits and shows that your kids will enjoy.

Day 2:
9:00 am - 11:00 am: Zengcuoan - Visit Zengcuoan, a scenic fishing village located in the southeastern part of Xiamen. The village is known for its beautiful beaches, narrow alleys, and historic architecture. Your family can explore the village and enjoy its laid-back atmosphere.
11:00 am - 12:00 pm: Lunch time
12:00 pm - 3:00 pm: Nanputuo Temple - Visit Nanputuo Temple, a famous Buddhist temple located on the southeast coast of Xiamen. The temple features beautiful architecture, lush gardens, and scenic views of the ocean. Your family can learn about the history and culture of the temple.
3:00 pm - 5:00 pm: Huandao Road - Take a drive or bike ride along Huandao Road, which runs along the coast of Xiamen. The road offers scenic views of the ocean, beaches, and cliffs. Your family can enjoy the beautiful scenery and take memorable photos.

Day 3:
9:00 am - 11:00 am: Xiamen Botanical Garden - Visit the Xiamen Botanical Garden, which features a diverse collection of plants from different parts of the world. The garden offers various themed gardens, including a rose garden, bamboo garden, and palm garden. Your kids might enjoy the petting zoo and playground in the garden.
11:00 am - 12:00 pm: Lunch time
12:00 pm - 3:00 pm: Jimei School Village - Visit Jimei School Village, a historic village located in the north of Xiamen. The village was founded by Tan Kah Kee, a famous Chinese philanthropist, and features a unique blend of Western and Chinese architecture. Your family can visit the Jimei Turtle Garden, the Tan Kah Kee Memorial Museum, and the Jimei Xiangshan Film City.
3:00 pm - 5:00 pm: Xiamen University - Take a walk in Xiamen University, one of the most beautiful universities in China. The university features beautiful architecture, gardens, and lakes. Your family can enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and take memorable photos.

Note: Zijin Mountain and West Lake are not located in Xiamen, Fujian Province. If there are any errors in my recommendations, please let me know.
